title: 107_s417
content: The Act titled "Homeownership Opportunities for Uniformed Services and Educators Act" allows reduced downpayment requirements for loans for teachers and public safety officers. The "Homeownership Opportunities for Uniformed Services and Educators Act" amends the National Housing Act to allow reduced downpayment requirements for teachers and public safety officers applying for mortgages. The mortgage amount cannot exceed 99% of the property's appraised value plus approved fees. The "Homeownership Opportunities for Uniformed Services and Educators Act" allows reduced downpayment requirements for teachers and public safety officers applying for mortgages. The mortgage must be executed by a mortgagor who has paid at least 1 percent of the property's acquisition cost in cash or its equivalent. The "Homeownership Opportunities for Uniformed Services and Educators Act" offers reduced downpayment requirements for teachers and public safety officers applying for mortgages. The mortgagor must be an individual employed as a teacher or administrator in a school providing elementary or secondary education. The "Homeownership Opportunities for Uniformed Services and Educators Act" provides reduced downpayment requirements for teachers and public safety officers applying for mortgages. The individual must be employed as a teacher or administrator in a school and must not have any present ownership during the 12-month period before the mortgage is issued. The Act offers reduced downpayment requirements for teachers and public safety officers applying for mortgages, provided they are employed in a school and do not own a principal residence in the jurisdiction within the 12-month period before the mortgage is issued. The Act allows for reduced downpayment requirements for teachers and public safety officers seeking mortgages, as long as they are employed in a school or public safety agency. The National Housing Act is amended to defer and reduce up-front premium payments for certain mortgages. If the mortgagor stops being employed as specified or pays off the mortgage within 5 years, a single premium payment will be collected by the Secretary. The National Housing Act is amended to defer and reduce up-front premium payments for certain mortgages. The Secretary will collect a single premium payment equal to the amount that would have been required under paragraph (2)(A) of this subsection, reduced by 20% for each completed 12-month period during a 5-year period before cessation or prepayment occurs.
